title: Empty harbours, empty dreams
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, distributor
National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Economic conditions

Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Federal government
description: The film explores how the three British colonies of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island became provinces of Canada, and it charts the subsequent decline of their economies after Confederation. Photographs, archival drawings, cartoons, and interviews with Maritime historians are used to document the case. An important contribution to the continuing dialogue on the history and evolution of Canada's federal system.
